communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Auror
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All emails and email notifications sent or received by agency personnel that include the domain "@auror.co". This includes but is not limited to notifications of incident reports, evidence exports, event updates, and other communications generated by the Auror software.
2. All exported reports generated by the Auror software. This includes reports exported in any format (PDF, HTML, JSON, etc.) and covers all types of reports such as evidence reports, incident reports, 3. All incident of investigative reports mentioning or involving the Auror software. This includes any reports or records where the Auror software was used to document, track, or investigate incidents.
4.  SOW, contracts, MOU, user manuals or technical documentation regarding the Auror platform. 

To assist with locating these records, the Auror software is a platform used for tracking, monitoring, and managing various incidents and retail crime investigations. It includes functionalities for exporting reports and sending email notifications.

Responsive documents should be from 1/1/2020 until the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Department of Energy Comms 10 Gas Turbines and Renewable Goal

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Energy Comms 10 Gas Turbines and Renewable Goal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that the Puerto Rico Energy Bureau has approved 10 natural gas turbines across Puerto Rico: https://www.elvocero.com/gobierno/aprobadas-10-nuevas-turbinas-con-gas-metano/article_07c5c64a-4a05-11ef-b5c7-77ec869aba6f.html

Reports show that New Fortress Energy, parent company of Genera PR, has breached their gas contact before: https://periodismoinvestigativo.com/2022/09/new-fortress-breaches-contract-on-gas-supply-puerto-ricos-government-allows-it/

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments sent between the Department of Energy (DOE) and Genera PR concerning the approval of permits for these 10 natural gas turbines and how it correlates with Puerto Rico's renewable energy law, which requires 100% renewable energy by 2050. To aid in your search, Genera PR employees emails likely all end with "@generapr.com." It is likely that these potential communications were sent from either the Office of Electricity, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management, the Federal Energy Management Program, Office of State and Community Energy Programs, or the Grid Deployment Office.

2) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments sent between the DOE and New Fortress Energy concerning the approval of permits for these 10 natural gas turbines and how it correlates with Puerto Rico's renewable energy law, which requires 100% renewable energy by 2050. To aid in your search, New Fortress Energy employee emails likely all end with "@newfortressenergy.com."  It is likely that these potential communications were sent from either the Office of Electricity, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management, the Federal Energy Management Program, Office of State and Community Energy Programs, or the Grid Deployment Office.

3) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments sent between the DOE and the Puerto Rico Energy Bureau (Negociado de Energy de Puerto Rico) concerning the approval of permits for these 10 natural gas turbines and how it correlates with Puerto Rico's renewable energy law, which requires 100% renewable energy by 2050. To aid in your search, PREB employee emails likely all end with "@energia.pr.gov."  It is likely that these potential communications were sent from either the Office of Electricity, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management, the Federal Energy Management Program, Office of State and Community Energy Programs, or the Grid Deployment Office.

3) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments sent between the DOE and the Puerto Rican government (including the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority (PREPA))  concerning the approval of permits for these 10 natural gas turbines and how it correlates with Puerto Rico's renewable energy law, which requires 100% renewable energy by 2050. It is likely that these potential communications were sent from either the Office of Electricity, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management, the Federal Energy Management Program, Office of State and Community Energy Programs, or the Grid Deployment Office. To aid in your search, PREPA employees email addresses end with "@prepar.pr.gov"

4) Documents, presentations, reports and informative material concerning the guidelines that regiment the approval of natural gas terminals and turbines in the United States and Puerto Rico, as well as how those approvals have to comply with local or state laws concerning renewable energy directives. In particular, I am searching for anything that specifically mentions the "Puerto Rico Energy Public Policy Act" also known as "Law 17-2019."

5) Any documents, presentations, reports and informative material concerning an investigation into how Puerto Rico is complying with it's renewable energy goals as stated within the "Puerto Rico Energy Public Policy Act" also known as "Law 17-2019." Please include any documentation about enforcement actions or penalties relating to renewable goals.

Keywords: "Genera PR," "New Fortress Energy," "Puerto Rico Energy Bureau," "Negociado de Energy de Puerto Rico" "natural gas turbine," "turbine permit," "natural gas permit" "PREPA" PR100" puerto rico renewable" "Puerto Rico Energy Public Policy Act" "Law 17-2019"

I am requesting records between January 1, 2024 and the date this request is processed.

These records are not being made for a commercial purpose. I am a freelance journalist and these records will be used in the course of reporting about the energy crisis in Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Rexvill Raid
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports reportedly show a raid on members of the protest group Campamento Resistencia: https://x.com/icyberpr/status/1652919559240790017

I have uploaded a document that purports to be the search and seizure warrant signed by the Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan on April 30, 2023 at 11:42pm. The document cites 18 U.S. Code § 2101(a)(1), 18 U.S. Code § 371, and 18 U.S. Code § 231 as justification for the warrant. The location listed for the raid is Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959. Reportedly, the raid was conducted on or about May 1, 2023.

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any interagency communications, emails, messages, and attachments concerning a raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

2) Any communications, emails, messages, and attachments between the DHS and other law enforcement agencies concerning a raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

3) Any after-action reports, memos, directives or presentations created in the aftermath of the raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

4) A copy of the search and seizure warrant used during the raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

Keywords: "Rexville," "Jeremiah Green" "SA Green" "campamento resistencia" "riot" "search warrant" "Judge Morgan" "Bayamon" "Bayamón"

The request is for all records between April 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Rexville Raid
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports reportedly show a raid on members of the protest group Campamento Resistencia: https://x.com/icyberpr/status/1652919559240790017

I have uploaded a document that purports to be the search and seizure warrant signed by the Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan on April 30, 2023 at 11:42pm. The document cites 18 U.S. Code § 2101(a)(1),  18 U.S. Code § 371, and 18 U.S. Code § 231 as justification for the warrant. The location listed for the raid is Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959. Reportedly, the raid was conducted on or about May 1, 2023.

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any interagency communications, emails, messages, and attachments concerning a raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

2) Any communications, emails, messages, and attachments between the FBI and other law enforcement agencies concerning a raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

3) Any after-action reports, memos, directives or presentations created in the aftermath of the raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

4) A copy of the search and seizure warrant used by the FBI during the raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

Keywords: "Rexville," "Jeremiah Green" "SA Green" "campamento resistencia" "riot" "search warrant" "Judge Morgan" "Bayamon" "Bayamón"

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The request is for all records between April 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and any records from this request will be used in the course of reporting about Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Lewis Henry Lapham (January 8, 1935 – July 23, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into magazine editor Lewis Henry Lapham (January 8, 1935 – July 23, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/24/business/media/lewis-h-lapham-dead.html

"Long ago and in another country, America in 1957, I sought enlistment in the CIA and sat for an interview with a credentials committee ordained by God and country and Allen Dulles," Lapham wrote in the introduction to the Winter 2016 edition (Volume IX, Number 1) of Lapham's Quarterly. He stated that the application process consisted of several days of "written, physical, and psychological examinations" that culminated in "an interview with five operatives in their late twenties...in a Quonset hut near the Lincoln Memorial." According to Lapham, that interview "put an end to my interest in the CIA." If any record of Lapham's application paperwork exists, I am requesting it.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any numerical results quantifying estimated delay time and backup length on I-5 Southbound near Woodlands as a result of Lewis Bridge repairs begun July 15,2024. Please include any reports, memoranda or otherwise pertinent department documents summarizing the anticipated traffic delay times for southbound travelers as a result of this closure.  

For reference, a press release from your department dated July 8 describing the lane closures noted that  "Traffic data shows that Friday afternoons are the worst days to travel, with delays of up to 70 minutes or longer, and backups extending beyond ten miles on southbound I-5 approaching the work zone."  [ URL: https://wsdot.wa.gov/about/news/2024/two-month-southbound-i-5-around-clock-lane-closure-woodland-begins-july-15  ]. Please provide the full data set of traffic delay times anticipated and the time of day and other variables considered.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Fenton

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: COPA America Finals 🇦🇷 v. 🇨🇴
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request access to records and footage related to any incidents that occurred on July 14th, 2024 to July 15th 2024, at Hard Rock Stadium, located at 347 Don Shula Dr Suite 102, Miami Gardens, FL 33056. 

1. Body Camera Footage: All body camera footage from officers present at Hard Rock Stadium on July 14th, covering events leading up to the incident, interactions with individuals involved, and actions taken by officers during and after the incident.

2. Incident Reports: Comprehensive incident reports detailing the events at Hard Rock Stadium on July 14th, including charges filed, statements made by involved parties, and circumstances leading to the arrests.

3. Arrest Records: Records of all individuals arrested in connection with the incident, including specifics about the arrest, charges filed, and any statements made during the booking process.

4. Witness Statements: Any witness statements or reports from individuals who observed or were involved in the incident.

5. Dispatch Records: All dispatch call logs and recordings related to the incident.

6. Surveillance Footage: Any available surveillance footage from Hard Rock Stadium or nearby areas that captured the incident.

7. CCTV Evidence: CCTV footage from Hard Rock Stadium covering the incident.

8. Traffic Camera Footage: Any traffic camera footage from the surrounding area that captured the incident or related events.

9. Police Helicopter Footage: Any aerial footage from police helicopters during the incident.

10. Communication Records: Internal communications, including emails, text messages, and radio transmissions related to the incident.

11. Officer Notes: Any additional notes or reports made by officers involved in or responding to the incident.

12. Other Relevant Documentation: Any other documentation or records pertinent to the incident.

Please provide any records that are readily available at no cost. If the cost of fulfilling this request exceeds $20, please notify me before processing the records. As similar records have been previously produced for news organizations, the costs associated with providing these records should be minimal or waived. The records I am requesting pertain to incidents at Hard Rock Stadium on July 14th, 2024. Given that these records have already been released to media outlets, I expect that the retrieval and distribution of these documents will not incur significant expenses. Please ensure that any charges are clearly justified. Thank you for your cooperation and attention to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

Dear National Park Service:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to NPS mascot Freddie the Flathead Catfish, the mascot of the Mississippi National River and Recreation Area.

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design of the Freddie the Flathead Catfish mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to NPS's decision to create a mascot for the Mississippi National River and Recreation Area in the first place. 

2. Please produce all Freddie-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, videos, worksheets, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any wearable Freddie costumes. Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Freddie.

5. Please produce all photographs of Freddie. You may omit any photographs already posted to the agency’s Flickr page https://www.flickr.com/photos/134392837@N04/albums/.

6. Please produce all correspondence related to Freddie (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Senator Joni Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some mascot-related correspondence around 2019.

7. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision to stop using Freddie as part of NPS's public outreach.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Contract, FinalSite
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Records sufficient to show the contract for ACTIVE INTERNET TECHNOLOGIES, LLC DBA FINALSITE as authorized by Board Report 23-0322-PR8.
2. All invoices produced by Active Internet Technologies, LLC dba FinalSite during this contract term, to date.

Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N015889-072324

title: Contract between Master Marine, Inc and DHS

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the following contract, including any post-signing amendment[s], addenda, new / later Statement[s] of Work, Change Order[s], and other documents that supplement or amend the original contract and any documentation supplied by Master Marine, Inc in how they spent allocated funds, between Master Marine, Inc. and the Department of Homeland Security. Specifically, I am requesting these documents for the definitive contract PIID 70Z08520CP4504600 in 2020.  

Responsive materials should include but not be limited to:

• the initial Invitation to Bid, Request for Proposal, or equivalent call for contractors
• the responsive materials provided by the winning bidder
• all other vendor responses
• all evaluation material, scorecards, reports, and notes generated in the selection process
• the current contract
• all exhibits
• all amendments
• all invoices/receipts detailing compensation received as a result of any agreements
• all agreements related to the provision of services

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am an investigative researcher for Bellingcat, and I am requesting this information in that capacity and request that fees be waived for this request. 

Bellingcat is widely recognized for its reporting, and publishing regular features on issues of public interest and importance using open source, such as the below examples:

https://www.bellingcat.com/news/2024/03/03/tobago-oil-spill-tug-solo-creed-belonged-to-panamanian-firm/
https://www.bellingcat.com/news/2023/05/09/tracing-the-odnoklassniki-profile-of-the-texas-mall-shooter/
https://www.bellingcat.com/news/2024/03/27/fugitive-us-militant-ammon-bundy-geolocated-to-utah/ 

And you see some of my reporting at Bellingcat here:
https://www.bellingcat.com/news/2023/11/16/from-pixels-to-punches-geolocating-a-neo-nazi-and-white-nationalist-combat-event-in-los-angeles/ 
https://www.bellingcat.com/news/2023/11/27/anydream-secretive-ai-platform-broke-stripe-rules-to-rake-in-money-from-nonconsensual-pornographic-deepfakes/
https://www.bellingcat.com/news/2023/12/08/images-of-syrian-civil-war-take-on-a-second-life-in-gaza-conflict/

If you have any questions about my media status, please contact me.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kolina Koltai

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Sam Watson CORA Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), I am requesting access to and a copy of the logs of all CORA requests submitted to your office over the past 180 days. This request includes, but is not limited to, the dates of requests, the nature of the requests, the responses provided, and any associated correspondence. As well as, any correspondence with Sam Watson Police Chief of Englewood,CO in regards to a CORA request going back two years (07/23/2022 to 07/23/2024).

Please provide the requested records in an electronic format if possible. If there are any fees for searching, reviewing, or copying the records, please inform me before processing my request. Additionally, if you need any further information or clarification to locate these records, please let me know at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your assistance and prompt attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

 On July 24, 2024:
Subject: Englewood City Clerk's Office - CORA Request CORA-2024-16: Clarification Requested
RE: Request Number Request Number: CORA-2024-16
Submitted on: 7/24/2024

Dear Samuel Newton,

Your request for records has been routed to the City departments of record, and staff determined that more information is needed to complete it.

Records regarding Police Department are maintained separately from the rest of the records of the municipality. CORA requests processed by the City will not include any requests involving Sam Watson - requests for those responses would need to be sent directly to PD. We will be able to search emails and provide CORA responses from the City through this process, and we just wanted to clarify if that is what you were looking for before we begin.

If a response is not received in 7 days, your request will be considered closed.

Thank you,

Englewood City Clerk's Office
1000 Englewood Parkway, 3rd Floor
Englewood, Colorado 80110
303-762-2430
cityclerk@englewoodco.gov

Please provide the requested records in an electronic format if possible. If there are any fees for searching, reviewing, or copying the records, please inform me before processing my request. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Off-road Automotive
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request information regarding complaints filed against Off-Road Automotive, located at 13015 Co Rd 16, Fort Lupton, CO 80621, under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), C.R.S. 24-72-201 et seq. Specifically, I am seeking detailed records of any complaints originating with the Auto Industry Division, including but not limited to:

    The nature and description of each complaint.
    The dates on which each complaint was filed.
    The current status or resolution of each complaint.
    Any actions taken by the Auto Industry Division in response to these complaints.

Additionally, if any of the requested records are not readily available, I request that those records be processed and sent separately as soon as they become available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Hearing Officer Appointment Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request information regarding the scheduling of hearing officers for appeal hearings related to unemployment claims under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), C.R.S. 24-72-201 et seq. Specifically, I am seeking detailed logs and records for the past 12 months pertaining to:

    The schedules of hearing officers assigned to appeal hearings for unemployment claims.
    The number of appeals scheduled, rescheduled, and heard by each hearing officer.
    The criteria and process used to assign hearing officers to specific cases.
    Any records or logs indicating the number of appeals pending assignment to a hearing officer.
    The average time from appeal filing to hearing date assignment.

Additionally, if any of the requested records are not readily available, I request that those records be processed and sent separately as soon as they become available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: AI disclosures
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In October 2023, President Biden signed an executive order on the Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Development and Use of Artificial Intelligence. Section 4.2(a) of this order requires that companies inform the federal government if they are "developing or demonstrating an intent to develop" AI models or computing clusters that exceed certain computing power thresholds.

I am requesting copies of information, reports, and records sent to the Commerce Department by companies pursuant to Section 4.2 of the Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Development and Use of Artificial Intelligence. Specifically, I am requesting records sent by Amazon, Alphabet, Microsoft, OpenAI, Meta, Anthropic, and any other companies that have disclosed AI models or computing clusters pursuant to Section 4.2 between October 2023 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Holmes
